response.overview: Long before the invention of YouTube and smartphones, Video 125 cameras were out and about filming the London Underground for our Driverâ€™s eye view videos.  Although mainly filmed in standard definition, the sound was a different matter.  100% of the time we were using full broadcast television standard microphones and recording equipment. This means that long-since scrapped 1959, 1962 and 1967 tube stock on the Central, Northern and Victoria lines can still be heard in full stereo sound. The long-since scrapped A, C and D sub-surface stock on the Hammersmith & City, Circle, District and Metropolitan, lines also heavily feature in this unique video production filmed between 1988 and 2014.
response.title: Underground Tracks
